kgurushankar.shapes

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • kgurushankar.shapes.Shape1D
      • kgurushankar.shapes.Shape2D
        • kgurushankar.shapes.Rectangle

  • public class Rectangle
extends Shape2D
    This class represents a rectangle
    Author:
    kgurushankar

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class kgurushankar.shapes.Shape2D

        fillColor

      • Fields inherited from class kgurushankar.shapes.Shape1D

        line

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle()
      Creates a default instance of a Rectangle object with all dimensions set to zero.
      Rectangle(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object.
      Rectangle(double x, double y, double width, double height, java.awt.Color c, double strokeWidth)
      Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object.
      Rectangle(double x, double y, double width, double height, java.awt.Color c, double strokeWidth, java.awt.Color fillColor)
      Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object.
      Rectangle(Shape1D shape)
      Copy Constructor
      Can be used to get a rectangle with the same defining line as the shape given
      note that this does not copy fillColor over
      to do that use Rectangle(Shape2D) instead
      Rectangle(Shape2D shape)
      Copy Constructor
      Can be used to get a rectangle with the same defining line and same fill settings as the shape given

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle()
        Creates a default instance of a Rectangle object with all dimensions set to zero.

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(double x,
                 double y,
                 double width,
                 double height,
                 java.awt.Color c,
                 double strokeWidth,
                 java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        y - Y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        width - Width of the rectangle in pixels
        height - Height of the rectangle in pixels
        c - Color of this shape
        strokeWidth - weight of the line this shape will be drawn with
        fillColor - color this shape will be filled with

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(double x,
                 double y,
                 double width,
                 double height)
        Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object. It will have a black color and will have a strokewidth of 2
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        y - Y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        width - Width of the rectangle in pixels
        height - Height of the rectangle in pixels

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(double x,
                 double y,
                 double width,
                 double height,
                 java.awt.Color c,
                 double strokeWidth)
        Creates a new instance of a Rectangle object.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        y - Y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle
        width - Width of the rectangle in pixels
        height - Height of the rectangle in pixels
        c - Color of this shape
        strokeWidth - weight of the line this shape will be drawn with

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(Shape2D shape)
        Copy Constructor
        Can be used to get a rectangle with the same defining line and same fill settings as the shape given
        Parameters:
        shape - shape to copy data from

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(Shape1D shape)
        Copy Constructor
        Can be used to get a rectangle with the same defining line as the shape given
        note that this does not copy fillColor over
        to do that use Rectangle(Shape2D) instead
        Parameters:
        shape - shape to copy data from
